    36â†’    const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
    37â†’    return params.get('id');
    38â†’}
    39â†’
    40â†’// Canvas management
    41â†’function updateOutputLayout() {
    42â†’    const outputContent = document.getElementById('outputContent');
    43â†’    const canvasPane = document.getElementById('canvasPane');
    44â†’    const popoutBtn = document.getElementById('popoutCanvasBtn');
    45â†’
    46â†’    // Remove all layout classes
    47â†’    outputContent.classList.remove('console-only', 'canvas-only', 'split');
    48â†’
    49â†’    if (state.canvasUsed && state.consoleUsed) {
    50â†’        // Both used: show split view
    51â†’        outputContent.classList.add('split');
    52â†’        canvasPane.style.display = 'flex';
    53â†’        popoutBtn.style.display = 'inline-block';
    54â†’    } else if (state.canvasUsed) {
    55â†’        // Only canvas: show canvas only
    56â†’        outputContent.classList.add('canvas-only');
    57â†’        canvasPane.style.display = 'flex';
    58â†’        popoutBtn.style.display = 'inline-block';
    59â†’    } else {
    60â†’        // Only console (or neither): show console only
    61â†’        outputContent.classList.add('console-only');
    62â†’        canvasPane.style.display = 'none';
    63â†’        popoutBtn.style.display = 'none';
    64â†’    }
    65â†’}
    66â†’
    67â†’function markCanvasUsed() {
    68â†’    state.canvasUsed = true;
    69â†’    updateOutputLayout();
    70â†’}
    71â†’
    72â†’function markConsoleUsed() {
    73â†’    if (!state.consoleUsed) {
    74â†’        state.consoleUsed = true;
    75â†’        updateOutputLayout();
    76â†’    }
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’function clearOutput() {
    80â†’    // Clear terminal
    81â†’    state.terminal.clear();
    82â†’
    83â†’    // Clear canvas
    84â†’    const canvas = document.getElementById('outputCanvas');
    85â†’    const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
    86â†’    ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
    87â†’
    88â†’    // Reset usage flags
    89â†’    state.canvasUsed = false;
    90â†’    state.consoleUsed = false;
    91â†’    updateOutputLayout();
    92â†’}
    93â†’
    94â†’function popoutCanvas() {

    99â†’    const windowHeight = canvas.height + 100;

  1143â†’            return;
  1144â†’        }

  1149â†’            return;
  1150â†’        }
  1151â†’

  1169â†’
  1170â†’        // Stop sync check interval

  1186â†’} else {
  1187â†’    init();
  1188â†’}

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-22 14:52:21

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 3 in / 6 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

ðŸ’­ Thinking

Perfect! Let me create a summary of the fixes for the user.

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-22 14:52:29

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 3 in / 6 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Perfect! I've fixed both issues:

Fix 1: Service Worker Query Parameter Handling

Problem: When creating a trifle offline, the URL like /editor.html?id=trifle_ce6c69ad4619 wasn't being matched against the cached /editor.html.

Solution: Modified the service worker to strip query parameters when looking for cached resources:

  1. First tries to match the exact request
  2. If not found and there are query parameters, tries again without them
  3. Only then falls back to network

Changes: Updated web/sw.js (cache version bumped to v15)

Fix 2: WebAssembly Detection

Problem: When WebAssembly is disabled (common in enterprise Chrome), the editor would show an infinite spinner with only console errors.

Solution: Added WebAssembly detection at the start of editor initialization with a helpful error message explaining:

  • Why WebAssembly is needed
  • Common reasons it might be unavailable
  • What to try (different browser, check settings, contact IT)

Changes: Updated web/js/editor.js

Both fixes are ready to test. The service worker will automatically update on next page load, and the WebAssembly check will show a user-friendly alert before the editor even tries to load.

Ready to commit?

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-22 14:59:05

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-22 15:00:05

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 9 in / 2 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

ðŸ’­ Thinking

Let me review what we learned in this session and what's currently in CLAUDE.md:

Current CLAUDE.md includes:

  • Local-first architecture description
  • Status of what's completed
  • Key decisions (local-first, KV store, logical clocks, etc.)
  • Module organization
  • Python features (input(), ANSI colors)
  • Editor shortcuts
  • Modal UX
  • KV sync schema
  • Workflow (code review before commits)

Things learned in this session:

  1. Service worker query parameter handling - URLs with query params should fall back to base URL
  2. WebAssembly detection is needed for helpful error messages
  3. Environment variable preferences: PORT + OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL (not ADDRESS)
  4. Production mode inferred from OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL scheme
  5. Server is designed to run behind reverse proxy (Caddy)
  6. Service worker version must be bumped when cache behavior changes
  7. Modal UX keyboard shortcuts (already documented)

What's worth adding to CLAUDE.md:

  • Service worker cache versioning (when to bump)
  • Query parameter handling for SPA-style URLs
  • WebAssembly requirement and detection

What can be removed/simplified:

  • The "Critical: SQLite Dependency" section is gone (no more SQLite)
  • Some details about module organization could be more concise

Let me draft a succinct update.

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 9 in / 2 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Good call! Let me review CLAUDE.md and propose updates:

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-22 15:00:06

Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Result:

     1â†’# Trifle - Project Context for Claude
     2â†’
     3â†’## What This Is
     4â†’Local-first browser-based Python3 playground using Pyodide (WASM). All code execution happens client-side. Optional Google OAuth for syncing data to server.
     5â†’
     6â†’## Current Status
     7â†’**Completed:**
     8â†’- âœ… IndexedDB storage layer (client-side)
     9â†’- âœ… Service worker for offline support
    10â†’- âœ… Pyodide integration with web worker execution
    11â†’- âœ… Multi-file editor with auto-save
    12â†’- âœ… ANSI terminal output support
    13â†’- âœ… `input()` support for interactive programs
    14â†’- âœ… Google OAuth authentication (optional, for sync)
    15â†’- âœ… Bidirectional sync with file-based KV store
    16â†’- âœ… Profile management with random name generation
    17â†’
    18â†’**Run locally:**
    19â†’```bash
    20â†’export GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID="$(op read 'op://Shared/Trifle/Google OAuth Client ID')"
    21â†’export GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET="$(op read 'op://Shared/Trifle/Google OAuth Client Secret')"
    22â†’go run main.go  # â†’ http://localhost:3000
    23â†’```
    24â†’
    25â†’**Key decisions:**
    26â†’- **Local-first**: All data in browser IndexedDB, no account required
    27â†’- **Optional sync**: Google OAuth only needed for backup/restore
    28â†’- **Pure KV store**: Server never parses user data, just stores opaque bytes
    29â†’- **Content-addressed storage**: Files stored by SHA-256 hash for deduplication
    30â†’- **Logical clocks**: Conflict resolution for bidirectional sync
    31â†’- **SameSite=Lax** (not Strict) for OAuth callback compatibility
    32â†’- **Production detection**: Inferred from OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL scheme (https = secure cookies)
    33â†’- Client-side execution = **works offline** (after initial load)
    34â†’- Graceful offline handling (service worker shows "Offline" page)
    35â†’
    36â†’## Module Organization
    37â†’- `internal/auth/` - Google OAuth, sessions (email-based, no DB)
    38â†’- `internal/kv/` - File-based key-value store for sync
    39â†’- `web/` - Static frontend (Ace editor, Pyodide, vanilla JS)
    40â†’  - `js/app.js` - Main app controller, trifle list, modals
    41â†’  - `js/db.js` - IndexedDB storage layer with content addressing
    42â†’  - `js/editor.js` - File tree, auto-save, Pyodide execution, `input()` support, ANSI color parsing
    43â†’  - `js/sync-kv.js` - Bidirectional sync manager
    44â†’  - `js/namegen.js` - Client-side random name generator
    45â†’  - `sw.js` - Service worker for offline support
    46â†’
    47â†’## Python Features
    48â†’
    49â†’**`input()` Support**: Terminal-style input directly in the console (like real Python REPL)
    50â†’- Type appears in the console as you enter it
    51â†’- Press Enter to submit
    52â†’- Works for classroom scenarios (guess-the-number, interactive programs, etc.)
    53â†’```python
    54â†’name = input("What's your name? ")
    55â†’print(f"Hello, {name}!")
    56â†’```
    57â†’
    58â†’**ANSI Color Codes**: Full support for terminal colors and backgrounds
    59â†’```python
    60â†’print('\x1b[31mRed text\x1b[0m')
    61â†’print('\x1b[32;40mGreen on black\x1b[0m')
    62â†’```
    63â†’
    64â†’Supported codes: 30-37 (foreground), 40-47 (background), 49 (bg default), 0 (reset)
    65â†’
    66â†’## Editor Shortcuts
    67â†’
    68â†’- **Cmd+Enter** (Mac) / **Ctrl+Enter** (Windows/Linux) - Run code
    69â†’- Auto-save after 1 second of typing inactivity
    70â†’
    71â†’## Modal UX
    72â†’
    73â†’New Trifle modal:
    74â†’- Auto-focuses title field
    75â†’- **Cmd/Ctrl+Enter** to submit
    76â†’- **Esc** to cancel
    77â†’
    78â†’## Workflow
    79â†’
    80â†’**Before committing**: Always use Task tool to launch a code review agent to check for issues.
    81â†’
    82â†’## KV Sync Schema
    83â†’
    84â†’Server stores user data in flat files:
    85â†’```
    86â†’data/
    87â†’â”œâ”€â”€ user/{email}/profile                              # User profile JSON
    88â†’â”œâ”€â”€ user/{email}/trifle/latest/{trifle_id}/{version}  # Latest version pointer (empty file)
    89â†’â”œâ”€â”€ user/{email}/trifle/version/{version}             # Version metadata with file refs
    90â†’â””â”€â”€ file/{hash[0:2]}/{hash[2:4]}/{hash}               # Content-addressed files (global)
    91â†’```
    92â†’
    93â†’- Email-based access control (user can only access their own data)
    94â†’- `file/*` is global (content-addressed, anyone can read/write)
    95â†’- Version ID = `version_{hash[0:16]}`
    96â†’
    97â†’---
    98â†’
    99â†’**IMPORTANT FOR CLAUDE**: When you notice information in conversations that either:
   100â†’1. Contradicts something in this file, OR
   101â†’2. Seems important enough to add (architectural decisions, gotchas, invariants)
   102â†’
   103â†’â†’ Start a conversation with the user about updating CLAUDE.md. Keep it high-value and succinct.
   104â†’

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-22 15:00:26

{
  "file_path": "/Users/zellyn/gh/trifle/CLAUDE.md",
  "content": "# Trifle - Project Context for Claude\n\n## What This Is\nLocal-first Python3 playground using Pyodide (WASM). All execution client-side. Optional Google OAuth for sync.\n\n## Architecture\n- **Local-first**: All data in browser IndexedDB, no account required\n- **Optional sync**: OAuth only for backup/restore to file-based KV store\n- **Content-addressed**: Files stored by SHA-256, deduplicated\n- **Offline-capable**: Service worker caches app, works without network\n- **WebAssembly required**: Editor checks and shows helpful error if unavailable\n\n## Key Decisions\n- Pure KV store: server never parses user data\n- Logical clocks: conflict resolution for bidirectional sync\n- Email-based auth: no user IDs, email is identity\n- SameSite=Lax: for OAuth callback compatibility\n- Production mode: inferred from OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL scheme (https = secure cookies)\n- Reverse proxy friendly: designed for Caddy/nginx TLS termination\n\n## Module Organization\n- `internal/auth/` - OAuth, sessions (email-based)\n- `internal/kv/` - File-based KV store for sync\n- `web/js/` - app.js (list), db.js (IndexedDB), editor.js (Ace+Pyodide), sync-kv.js, namegen.js\n- `web/sw.js` - Service worker (**bump version** when cache behavior changes)\n\n## Service Worker\n- Caches static files and CDN resources (Pyodide, Ace)\n- Query params: strips them for cache matching (e.g., `/editor.html?id=xyz` \u2192 `/editor.html`)\n- Never caches `/api/*` endpoints\n- Version format: `v{number}` - increment when changing cache logic\n\n## Python Features\n- `input()` with terminal-style prompt\n- ANSI color codes (30-37 fg, 40-47 bg, 0 reset)\n- Web worker execution (non-blocking)\n\n## KV Sync Schema\n```\ndata/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 user/{email}/profile                              # Profile JSON\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 user/{email}/trifle/latest/{trifle_id}/{version}  # Pointer (empty)\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 user/{email}/trifle/version/{version}             # Metadata + file refs\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 file/{hash[0:2]}/{hash[2:4]}/{hash}               # Global, content-addressed\n```\n- Email-based access control\n- `file/*` is public (content-addressed)\n- Version ID = `version_{hash[0:16]}`\n\n## Shortcuts\n- **Cmd/Ctrl+Enter**: Run code\n- **Cmd/Ctrl+Enter** in modal: Submit\n- **Esc** in modal: Cancel\n- Auto-save after 1s idle\n\n## Run Locally\n```bash\nexport GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=\"$(op read 'op://Shared/Trifle/Google OAuth Client ID')\"\nexport GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=\"$(op read 'op://Shared/Trifle/Google OAuth Client Secret')\"\ngo run main.go  # \u2192 http://localhost:3000\n```\n\n## Workflow\nBefore committing: Use Task tool to launch code review agent.\n\n---\n\n**For Claude**: Update this file when you notice contradictions or important architectural decisions.\n"
}

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-22 15:00:27

The file /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1â†’# Trifle - Project Context for Claude
     2â†’
     3â†’## What This Is
     4â†’Local-first Python3 playground using Pyodide (WASM). All execution client-side. Optional Google OAuth for sync.
     5â†’
     6â†’## Architecture
     7â†’- **Local-first**: All data in browser IndexedDB, no account required
     8â†’- **Optional sync**: OAuth only for backup/restore to file-based KV store
     9â†’- **Content-addressed**: Files stored by SHA-256, deduplicated
    10â†’- **Offline-capable**: Service worker caches app, works without network
    11â†’- **WebAssembly required**: Editor checks and shows helpful error if unavailable
    12â†’
    13â†’## Key Decisions
    14â†’- Pure KV store: server never parses user data
    15â†’- Logical clocks: conflict resolution for bidirectional sync
    16â†’- Email-based auth: no user IDs, email is identity
    17â†’- SameSite=Lax: for OAuth callback compatibility
    18â†’- Production mode: inferred from OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL scheme (https = secure cookies)
    19â†’- Reverse proxy friendly: designed for Caddy/nginx TLS termination
    20â†’
    21â†’## Module Organization
    22â†’- `internal/auth/` - OAuth, sessions (email-based)
    23â†’- `internal/kv/` - File-based KV store for sync
    24â†’- `web/js/` - app.js (list), db.js (IndexedDB), editor.js (Ace+Pyodide), sync-kv.js, namegen.js
    25â†’- `web/sw.js` - Service worker (**bump version** when cache behavior changes)
    26â†’
    27â†’## Service Worker
    28â†’- Caches static files and CDN resources (Pyodide, Ace)
    29â†’- Query params: strips them for cache matching (e.g., `/editor.html?id=xyz` â†’ `/editor.html`)
    30â†’- Never caches `/api/*` endpoints
    31â†’- Version format: `v{number}` - increment when changing cache logic
    32â†’
    33â†’## Python Features
    34â†’- `input()` with terminal-style prompt
    35â†’- ANSI color codes (30-37 fg, 40-47 bg, 0 reset)
    36â†’- Web worker execution (non-blocking)
    37â†’
    38â†’## KV Sync Schema
    39â†’```
    40â†’data/
    41â†’â”œâ”€â”€ user/{email}/profile                              # Profile JSON
    42â†’â”œâ”€â”€ user/{email}/trifle/latest/{trifle_id}/{version}  # Pointer (empty)
    43â†’â”œâ”€â”€ user/{email}/trifle/version/{version}             # Metadata + file refs
    44â†’â””â”€â”€ file/{hash[0:2]}/{hash[2:4]}/{hash}               # Global, content-addressed
    45â†’```
    46â†’- Email-based access control
    47â†’- `file/*` is public (content-addressed)
    48â†’- Version ID = `version_{hash[0:16]}`
    49â†’
    50â†’## Shortcuts
    51â†’- **Cmd/Ctrl+Enter**: Run code
    52â†’- **Cmd/Ctrl+Enter** in modal: Submit
    53â†’- **Esc** in modal: Cancel
    54â†’- Auto-save after 1s idle
    55â†’
    56â†’## Run Locally
    57â†’```bash
    58â†’export GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID="$(op read 'op://Shared/Trifle/Google OAuth Client ID')"
    59â†’export GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET="$(op read 'op://Shared/Trifle/Google OAuth Client Secret')"
    60â†’go run main.go  # â†’ http://localhost:3000
    61â†’```
    62â†’
    63â†’## Workflow
    64â†’Before committing: Use Task tool to launch code review agent.
    65â†’

The user is reporting an issue with the OAuth authentication - they're able to log in as any email, even emails that aren't in an allowlist. But wait... let me think about the current architecture.

  • We removed the SQLite database entirely
  • We moved to a local-first architecture with optional sync
  • The server is now just a pure KV store
  • Authentication is email-based (no user IDs)

So... is there even an allowlist anymore? Let me check what we know:

  1. The old system had an email allowlist in the database
  2. We deleted all the database code
  3. The current system uses Google OAuth just for sync to the KV store

I don't think we have an allowlist anymore! The user is mentioning an allowlist, but I don't think we ever implemented one in the new architecture. Let me check what the current auth code looks like.

From the conversation, I know we:

  • Removed internal/db/ entirely
  • Simplified OAuth to just store email in session
  • No database lookups for user creation or allowlist checking

So the issue is: we don't have an allowlist at all in the new architecture! Anyone can log in with Google OAuth.

The user seems to expect an allowlist to exist. We should:

  1. Confirm there's no allowlist in the current code
  2. Ask if they want one (and where it should be configured)
  3. Implement it if they want it

  1. Research the current auth code to confirm there's no allowlist
  2. Ask the user if they want an allowlist
  3. Present a plan for implementing it

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-24 20:40:06

Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Result:

     1â†’package auth
     2â†’
     3â†’import (
     4â†’	"context"
     5â†’	"encoding/json"
     6â†’	"fmt"
     7â†’	"io"
     8â†’	"log/slog"
     9â†’	"net/http"
    10â†’	"os"
    11â†’
    12â†’	"golang.org/x/oauth2"
    13â†’	"golang.org/x/oauth2/google"
    14â†’)
    15â†’
    16â†’// OAuthConfig holds OAuth configuration
    17â†’type OAuthConfig struct {
    18â†’	Config      *oauth2.Config
    19â†’	SessionMgr  *SessionManager
    20â†’	RedirectURL string
    21â†’}
    22â†’
    23â†’// GoogleUser represents user info from Google
    24â†’type GoogleUser struct {
    25â†’	ID            string `json:"id"`
    26â†’	Email         string `json:"email"`
    27â†’	VerifiedEmail bool   `json:"verified_email"`
    28â†’	Name          string `json:"name"`
    29â†’	Picture       string `json:"picture"`
    30â†’}
    31â†’
    32â†’// NewOAuthConfig creates a new OAuth configuration
    33â†’func NewOAuthConfig(clientID, clientSecret, redirectURL string, sessMgr *SessionManager) *OAuthConfig {
    34â†’	return &OAuthConfig{
    35â†’		Config: &oauth2.Config{
    36â†’			ClientID:     clientID,
    37â†’			ClientSecret: clientSecret,
    38â†’			RedirectURL:  redirectURL,
    39â†’			Scopes: []string{
    40â†’				"https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email",
    41â†’				"https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile",
    42â†’			},
    43â†’			Endpoint: google.Endpoint,
    44â†’		},
    45â†’		SessionMgr:  sessMgr,
    46â†’		RedirectURL: redirectURL,
    47â†’	}
    48â†’}
    49â†’
    50â†’// HandleLogin redirects the user to Google's OAuth consent page
    51â†’func (oc *OAuthConfig) HandleLogin(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    52â†’	// Generate a random state token for CSRF protection
    53â†’	state, err := generateRandomString(32)
    54â†’	if err != nil {
    55â†’		http.Error(w, "Failed to generate state token", http.StatusInternalServerError)
    56â†’		return
    57â†’	}
    58â†’
    59â†’	// Store state in session (we'll verify it in the callback)
    60â†’	session, err := oc.SessionMgr.GetOrCreateSession(r, w)
    61â†’	if err != nil {
    62â†’		http.Error(w, "Failed to create session", http.StatusInternalServerError)
    63â†’		return
    64â†’	}
    65â†’	session.OAuthState = state
    66â†’	if err := oc.SessionMgr.Save(w, session); err != nil {
    67â†’		http.Error(w, "Failed to save session", http.StatusInternalServerError)
    68â†’		return
    69â†’	}
    70â†’
    71â†’	// Redirect to Google's consent page
    72â†’	url := oc.Config.AuthCodeURL(state, oauth2.AccessTypeOffline)
    73â†’	http.Redirect(w, r, url, http.StatusTemporaryRedirect)
    74â†’}
    75â†’
    76â†’// HandleCallback processes the OAuth callback from Google
    77â†’func (oc *OAuthConfig) HandleCallback(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    78â†’	ctx := r.Context()
    79â†’
    80â†’	// Check for error from Google
    81â†’	if errMsg := r.URL.Query().Get("error"); errMsg != "" {
    82â†’		slog.Error("OAuth error from Google", "error", errMsg)
    83â†’		http.Error(w, fmt.Sprintf("OAuth error: %s", errMsg), http.StatusBadRequest)
    84â†’		return
    85â†’	}
    86â†’
    87â†’	// Get the session to verify state
    88â†’	session, err := oc.SessionMgr.GetSession(r)
    89â†’	if err != nil || session == nil {
    90â†’		slog.Warn("Invalid session in callback", "error", err)
    91â†’		http.Error(w, "Invalid session - please try logging in again", http.StatusBadRequest)
    92â†’		return
    93â†’	}
    94â†’
    95â†’	// Verify state token (CSRF protection)
    96â†’	state := r.URL.Query().Get("state")
    97â†’	if state == "" || state != session.OAuthState {
    98â†’		slog.Warn("State mismatch", "got", state, "expected", session.OAuthState)
    99â†’		http.Error(w, "Invalid state parameter - please try logging in again", http.StatusBadRequest)
   100â†’		return
   101â†’	}
   102â†’
   103â†’	// Exchange code for token
   104â†’	code := r.URL.Query().Get("code")
   105â†’	if code == "" {
   106â†’		slog.Warn("No code in callback")
   107â†’		http.Error(w, "No authorization code received", http.StatusBadRequest)
   108â†’		return
   109â†’	}
   110â†’
   111â†’	token, err := oc.Config.Exchange(ctx, code)
   112â†’	if err != nil {
   113â†’		slog.Error("Failed to exchange token", "error", err)
   114â†’		http.Error(w, fmt.Sprintf("Failed to exchange token: %v", err), http.StatusInternalServerError)
   115â†’		return
   116â†’	}
   117â†’
   118â†’	// Get user info from Google
   119â†’	userInfo, err := oc.getUserInfo(ctx, token)
   120â†’	if err != nil {
   121â†’		slog.Error("Failed to get user info", "error", err)
   122â†’		http.Error(w, fmt.Sprintf("Failed to get user info: %v", err), http.StatusInternalServerError)
   123â†’		return
   124â†’	}
   125â†’
   126â†’	slog.Info("User attempting to log in", "email", userInfo.Email, "name", userInfo.Name)
   127â†’
   128â†’	// Check if email is verified
   129â†’	if !userInfo.VerifiedEmail {
   130â†’		slog.Warn("Email not verified", "email", userInfo.Email)
   131â†’		http.Error(w, "Email not verified with Google", http.StatusForbidden)
   132â†’		return
   133â†’	}
   134â†’
   135â†’	slog.Info("Login successful", "email", userInfo.Email)
   136â†’
   137â†’	// Update session with user info
   138â†’	// Note: We no longer use separate user IDs - the email IS the user identifier
   139â†’	session.UserID = "" // Deprecated, keeping for compatibility
   140â†’	session.Email = userInfo.Email
   141â†’	session.Authenticated = true
   142â†’	session.OAuthState = "" // Clear the state token
   143â†’
   144â†’	if err := oc.SessionMgr.Save(w, session); err != nil {
   145â†’		slog.Error("Failed to save session", "error", err)
   146â†’		http.Error(w, "Failed to save session", http.StatusInternalServerError)
   147â†’		return
   148â†’	}
   149â†’
   150â†’	// Redirect to home page
   151â†’	http.Redirect(w, r, "/", http.StatusSeeOther)
   152â†’}
   153â†’
   154â†’// getUserInfo fetches user information from Google
   155â†’func (oc *OAuthConfig) getUserInfo(ctx context.Context, token *oauth2.Token) (*GoogleUser, error) {
   156â†’	client := oc.Config.Client(ctx, token)
   157â†’	resp, err := client.Get("https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v2/userinfo")
   158â†’	if err != nil {
   159â†’		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get user info: %w", err)
   160â†’	}
   161â†’	defer resp.Body.Close()
   162â†’
   163â†’	if resp.StatusCode != http.StatusOK {
   164â†’		body, _ := io.ReadAll(resp.Body)
   165â†’		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get user info, status: %d, body: %s", resp.StatusCode, body)
   166â†’	}
   167â†’
   168â†’	var userInfo GoogleUser
   169â†’	if err := json.NewDecoder(resp.Body).Decode(&userInfo); err != nil {
   170â†’		return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to decode user info: %w", err)
   171â†’	}
   172â†’
   173â†’	return &userInfo, nil
   174â†’}
   175â†’
   176â†’// HandleLogout logs the user out
   177â†’func (oc *OAuthConfig) HandleLogout(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
   178â†’	// Clear the session
   179â†’	oc.SessionMgr.Destroy(w, r)
   180â†’
   181â†’	// Redirect to home page
   182â†’	http.Redirect(w, r, "/", http.StatusSeeOther)
   183â†’}
   184â†’
   185â†’// GetOAuthCredentials retrieves OAuth credentials from environment
   186â†’func GetOAuthCredentials() (clientID, clientSecret string, err error) {
   187â†’	clientID = os.Getenv("GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID")
   188â†’	clientSecret = os.Getenv("GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET")
   189â†’
   190â†’	if clientID == "" {
   191â†’		return "", "", fmt.Errorf("GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID not set")
   192â†’	}
   193â†’	if clientSecret == "" {
   194â†’		return "", "", fmt.Errorf("GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET not set")
   195â†’	}
   196â†’
   197â†’	return clientID, clientSecret, nil
   198â†’}
   199â†’

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 20:40:14

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 11 in / 3 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

ðŸ’­ Thinking

I can see the issue now. Looking at the oauth.go file, around line 126-133:

slog.Info("User attempting to log in", "email", userInfo.Email, "name", userInfo.Name)

// Check if email is verified
if !userInfo.VerifiedEmail {
    slog.Warn("Email not verified", "email", userInfo.Email)
    http.Error(w, "Email not verified with Google", http.StatusForbidden)
    return
}

slog.Info("Login successful", "email", userInfo.Email)

There's NO allowlist check! It only checks if the email is verified with Google. Then it just lets anyone log in.

In the old architecture (which we deleted), there was a database with an email_allowlist table. But when we moved to the local-first architecture with a pure KV store, we removed all the database code including the allowlist.

So the user is correct - anyone can log in right now. We need to add an allowlist mechanism.

Options for implementing allowlist:

  1. Environment variable (comma-separated list)
  2. Text file with email patterns
  3. Config file (YAML/JSON)

I should ask the user what approach they prefer.

You're absolutely right - there's no allowlist in the current code! When we refactored to the local-first architecture and removed the SQLite database, we also removed the allowlist that was stored in the email_allowlist table.

Currently, the OAuth code only checks that the email is verified with Google (line 129-133 in oauth.go), then allows anyone to log in.

I need to understand what you want before implementing a fix:

Now let me create the allowlist module. I need to:

  1. Create a file that loads patterns from data/allowlist.txt

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 20:55:57

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 8 in / 2 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Tool: Write

Input:

{
  "file_path": "/Users/zellyn/gh/trifle/internal/auth/allowlist.go",
  "content": "package auth\n\nimport (\n\t\"bufio\"\n\t\"fmt\"\n\t\"log/slog\"\n\t\"os\"\n\t\"path/filepath\"\n\t\"strings\"\n)\n\n// Allowlist manages email access control\ntype Allowlist struct {\n\tpatterns []string\n}\n\n// defaultAllowlist contains the default allowed patterns if file doesn't exist\nvar defaultAllowlist = []string{\n\t\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\",\n\t\"@misstudent.com\",\n}\n\n// NewAllowlist loads the allowlist from a file\n// If the file doesn't exist, it creates it with default patterns\nfunc NewAllowlist(filePath string) (*Allowlist, error) {\n\t// Ensure data directory exists\n\tdir := filepath.Dir(filePath)\n\tif err := os.MkdirAll(dir, 0755); err != nil {\n\t\treturn nil, fmt.Errorf(\"failed to create directory: %w\", err)\n\t}\n\n\t// Check if file exists\n\tif _, err := os.Stat(filePath); os.IsNotExist(err) {\n\t\t// Create file with defaults\n\t\tslog.Info(\"Allowlist file not found, creating with defaults\", \"path\", filePath)\n\t\tif err := createDefaultAllowlist(filePath); err != nil {\n\t\t\treturn nil, fmt.Errorf(\"failed to create default allowlist: %w\", err)\n\t\t}\n\t}\n\n\t// Load patterns from file\n\tpatterns, err := loadAllowlist(filePath)\n\tif err != nil {\n\t\treturn nil, fmt.Errorf(\"failed to load allowlist: %w\", err)\n\t}\n\n\tslog.Info(\"Allowlist loaded\", \"patterns\", len(patterns), \"path\", filePath)\n\tfor _, pattern := range patterns {\n\t\tslog.Info(\"  Allowed pattern\", \"pattern\", pattern)\n\t}\n\n\treturn &Allowlist{\n\t\tpatterns: patterns,\n\t}, nil\n}\n\n// createDefaultAllowlist creates a new allowlist file with default patterns\nfunc createDefaultAllowlist(filePath string) error {\n\tfile, err := os.Create(filePath)\n\tif err != nil {\n\t\treturn err\n\t}\n\tdefer file.Close()\n\n\twriter := bufio.NewWriter(file)\n\tfor _, pattern := range defaultAllowlist {\n\t\tif _, err := writer.WriteString(pattern + \"\\n\"); err != nil {\n\t\t\treturn err\n\t\t}\n\t}\n\treturn writer.Flush()\n}\n\n// loadAllowlist reads patterns from a file\nfunc loadAllowlist(filePath string) ([]string, error) {\n\tfile, err := os.Open(filePath)\n\tif err != nil {\n\t\treturn nil, err\n\t}\n\tdefer file.Close()\n\n\tvar patterns []string\n\tscanner := bufio.NewScanner(file)\n\tfor scanner.Scan() {\n\t\tline := strings.TrimSpace(scanner.Text())\n\t\t// Skip empty lines and comments\n\t\tif line == \"\" || strings.HasPrefix(line, \"#\") {\n\t\t\tcontinue\n\t\t}\n\t\tpatterns = append(patterns, line)\n\t}\n\n\tif err := scanner.Err(); err != nil {\n\t\treturn nil, err\n\t}\n\n\treturn patterns, nil\n}\n\n// IsAllowed checks if an email is allowed by the allowlist\nfunc (a *Allowlist) IsAllowed(email string) bool {\n\temail = strings.ToLower(strings.TrimSpace(email))\n\n\tfor _, pattern := range a.patterns {\n\t\tpattern = strings.ToLower(strings.TrimSpace(pattern))\n\n\t\t// Check for domain wildcard (e.g., \"@anthropic.com\")\n\t\tif strings.HasPrefix(pattern, \"@\") {\n\t\t\tdomain := pattern // includes the @\n\t\t\tif strings.HasSuffix(email, domain) {\n\t\t\t\treturn true\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t} else {\n\t\t\t// Exact email match\n\t\t\tif email == pattern {\n\t\t\t\treturn true\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\t}\n\n\treturn false\n}\n"
}

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 20:59:36

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 8 in / 804 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Tool: Bash

Input:

{
  "command": "cat > /tmp/test_allowlist.go << 'EOF'\npackage main\n\nimport (\n\t\"fmt\"\n\t\"strings\"\n)\n\nfunc isAllowed(email string, patterns []string) bool {\n\temail = strings.ToLower(strings.TrimSpace(email))\n\t\n\tfor _, pattern := range patterns {\n\t\tpattern = strings.ToLower(strings.TrimSpace(pattern))\n\t\t\n\t\t// Check for domain wildcard (e.g., \"@anthropic.com\")\n\t\tif strings.HasPrefix(pattern, \"@\") {\n\t\t\tdomain := pattern // includes the @\n\t\t\tif strings.HasSuffix(email, domain) {\n\t\t\t\treturn true\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t} else {\n\t\t\t// Exact email match\n\t\t\tif email == pattern {\n\t\t\t\treturn true\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t}\n\t}\n\t\n\treturn false\n}\n\nfunc main() {\n\tpatterns := []string{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", \"@misstudent.com\"}\n\t\n\ttests := []struct {\n\t\temail    string\n\t\texpected bool\n\t}{\n\t\t{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", true},\n\t\t{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", true}, // case insensitive\n\t\t{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", false},\n\t\t{\"bevinand[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", false},\n\t\t{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", true},\n\t\t{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", true},\n\t\t{\"[REDACTED-EMAIL]\", true}, // case insensitive\n\t\t{\"user@example.com\", false},\n\t}\n\t\n\tfor _, test := range tests {\n\t\tresult := isAllowed(test.email, patterns)\n\t\tstatus := \"\u2713\"\n\t\tif result != test.expected {\n\t\t\tstatus = \"\u2717\"\n\t\t}\n\t\tfmt.Printf(\"%s %s -> %v (expected %v)\\n\", status, test.email, result, test.expected)\n\t}\n}\nEOF\ngo run /tmp/test_allowlist.go",
  "description": "Test allowlist pattern matching"
}

  "new_string": "## Key Decisions\n- Pure KV store: server never parses user data\n- Logical clocks: conflict resolution for bidirectional sync\n- Email-based auth: no user IDs, email is identity\n- Email allowlist: `data/allowlist.txt` controls OAuth access (exact emails + @domain wildcards)\n- SameSite=Lax: for OAuth callback compatibility\n- Production mode: inferred from OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL scheme (https = secure cookies)\n- Reverse proxy friendly: designed for Caddy/nginx TLS termination"
}

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-24 20:59:56

Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Result:

The file /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     9â†’- **Content-addressed**: Files stored by SHA-256, deduplicated
    10â†’- **Offline-capable**: Service worker caches app, works without network
    11â†’- **WebAssembly required**: Editor checks and shows helpful error if unavailable
    12â†’
    13â†’## Key Decisions
    14â†’- Pure KV store: server never parses user data
    15â†’- Logical clocks: conflict resolution for bidirectional sync
    16â†’- Email-based auth: no user IDs, email is identity
    17â†’- Email allowlist: `data/allowlist.txt` controls OAuth access (exact emails + @domain wildcards)
    18â†’- SameSite=Lax: for OAuth callback compatibility
    19â†’- Production mode: inferred from OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL scheme (https = secure cookies)
    20â†’- Reverse proxy friendly: designed for Caddy/nginx TLS termination
    21â†’
    22â†’## Module Organization
    23â†’- `internal/auth/` - OAuth, sessions (email-based)
    24â†’- `internal/kv/` - File-based KV store for sync

Summary

  • Auto-creates data/allowlist.txt with defaults: [REDACTED-EMAIL] and @misstudent.com

  • Returns "Access denied: email not authorized" for blocked emails

Pattern matching:

  • âœ… Exact emails: [REDACTED-EMAIL] (blocks bevinand[REDACTED-EMAIL])
  • âœ… Domain wildcards: @misstudent.com (allows all emails from that domain)
  • âœ… Case insensitive
  • âœ… Supports comments (#) and blank lines

Testing results:

âœ“ [REDACTED-EMAIL] -> allowed
âœ“ bevinand[REDACTED-EMAIL] -> blocked
âœ“ [REDACTED-EMAIL] -> blocked  
âœ“ [REDACTED-EMAIL] -> allowed (domain wildcard)

The server logs loaded patterns on startup for visibility. The data/allowlist.txt file is already covered by .gitignore.

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 21:05:26

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 21:05:36

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 11 in / 951 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Tool: Write

Input:

{
  "file_path": "/Users/zellyn/gh/trifle/web/js/notifications.js",
  "content": "// Simple notification system to replace alert()\n// Shows dismissible messages at the top of the page\n\n/**\n * Show a notification message\n * @param {string} message - The message to display\n * @param {string} type - Type of message: 'error', 'success', 'info' (default: 'info')\n * @param {number} autoDismiss - Auto-dismiss after N milliseconds (0 = no auto-dismiss)\n */\nexport function showMessage(message, type = 'info', autoDismiss = 0) {\n    // Get or create notification container\n    let container = document.getElementById('notificationContainer');\n    if (!container) {\n        container = document.createElement('div');\n        container.id = 'notificationContainer';\n        container.className = 'notification-container';\n        document.body.appendChild(container);\n    }\n\n    // Create notification element\n    const notification = document.createElement('div');\n    notification.className = `notification notification-${type}`;\n\n    // Message text\n    const messageEl = document.createElement('span');\n    messageEl.className = 'notification-message';\n    messageEl.textContent = message;\n    notification.appendChild(messageEl);\n\n    // Close button\n    const closeBtn = document.createElement('button');\n    closeBtn.className = 'notification-close';\n    closeBtn.innerHTML = '\u00d7';\n    closeBtn.setAttribute('aria-label', 'Close notification');\n    closeBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {\n        dismissNotification(notification);\n    });\n    notification.appendChild(closeBtn);\n\n    // Add to container\n    container.appendChild(notification);\n\n    // Trigger animation\n    requestAnimationFrame(() => {\n        notification.classList.add('notification-visible');\n    });\n\n    // Auto-dismiss if specified\n    if (autoDismiss > 0) {\n        setTimeout(() => {\n            dismissNotification(notification);\n        }, autoDismiss);\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * Dismiss a notification with animation\n * @param {HTMLElement} notification - The notification element to dismiss\n */\nfunction dismissNotification(notification) {\n    notification.classList.remove('notification-visible');\n    notification.classList.add('notification-dismissed');\n\n    // Remove from DOM after animation\n    setTimeout(() => {\n        notification.remove();\n\n        // Clean up container if empty\n        const container = document.getElementById('notificationContainer');\n        if (container && container.children.length === 0) {\n            container.remove();\n        }\n    }, 300);\n}\n\n/**\n * Convenience function for error messages\n * @param {string} message - The error message to display\n */\nexport function showError(message) {\n    showMessage(message, 'error');\n}\n\n/**\n * Convenience function for success messages\n * @param {string} message - The success message to display\n * @param {number} autoDismiss - Auto-dismiss after N milliseconds (default: 3000)\n */\nexport function showSuccess(message, autoDismiss = 3000) {\n    showMessage(message, 'success', autoDismiss);\n}\n\n/**\n * Convenience function for info messages\n * @param {string} message - The info message to display\n * @param {number} autoDismiss - Auto-dismiss after N milliseconds (default: 5000)\n */\nexport function showInfo(message, autoDismiss = 5000) {\n    showMessage(message, 'info', autoDismiss);\n}\n"
}

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 21:09:31

Model: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 Tokens: 0 in / 2 out Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

ðŸ’­ Thinking

Oh good catch! The user is right - when showing errors in the editor, we don't want to redirect to the homepage. The notifications will appear on the editor page itself since it's a fixed position banner at the top of any page. No redirect is needed - the error banner will show right on the editor page where the user is.

Actually, let me check if there are any places where we show an error and then redirect. Looking back at the code I changed:

  1. WebAssembly check - shows error then redirects to / (line 237-239) - this makes sense, editor can't work without WebAssembly
  2. Invalid trifle ID - shows error then redirects to / (line 245-247) - this also makes sense, can't edit without a valid ID

All the other errors (file operations, save failures, etc.) just show the error and stay on the page. So the current behavior is actually correct! The only redirects are for fatal errors where the editor can't function.

Let me explain this to the user.

ðŸ¤– ASSISTANT â€” 2025-10-24 21:09:32

ðŸ’­ Thinking

Good, those two redirects are for fatal initialization errors where the editor can't function at all:

  1. No WebAssembly - can't run Python
  2. No trifle ID - don't know what to edit

Both of these are correct to redirect. The notification banner will show briefly before the redirect happens, giving the user context about why they're being redirected.

For the file operation errors (create, delete, save), there are no redirects - they just show the error and stay on the page, which is correct.

Let me explain this to the user.

All the file operation errors (create file, delete file, save file, etc.) just show the notification banner and stay on the editor page. The user sees the error right there and can try again.

  • âœ… File errors in editor â†’ banner shows on editor page
  • âœ… Fatal init errors â†’ banner shows briefly, then redirects (user sees why)

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-24 21:10:39

Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Result:

     1â†’// Simple notification system to replace alert()
     2â†’// Shows dismissible messages at the top of the page
     3â†’
     4â†’/**
     5â†’ * Show a notification message
     6â†’ * @param {string} message - The message to display
     7â†’ * @param {string} type - Type of message: 'error', 'success', 'info' (default: 'info')
     8â†’ * @param {number} autoDismiss - Auto-dismiss after N milliseconds (0 = no auto-dismiss)
     9â†’ */
    10â†’export function showMessage(message, type = 'info', autoDismiss = 0) {
    11â†’    // Get or create notification container
    12â†’    let container = document.getElementById('notificationContainer');
    13â†’    if (!container) {
    14â†’        container = document.createElement('div');
    15â†’        container.id = 'notificationContainer';
    16â†’        container.className = 'notification-container';
    17â†’        document.body.appendChild(container);
    18â†’    }
    19â†’
    20â†’    // Create notification element
    21â†’    const notification = document.createElement('div');
    22â†’    notification.className = `notification notification-${type}`;
    23â†’
    24â†’    // Message text
    25â†’    const messageEl = document.createElement('span');
    26â†’    messageEl.className = 'notification-message';
    27â†’    messageEl.textContent = message;
    28â†’    notification.appendChild(messageEl);
    29â†’
    30â†’    // Close button
    31â†’    const closeBtn = document.createElement('button');
    32â†’    closeBtn.className = 'notification-close';
    33â†’    closeBtn.innerHTML = 'Ã—';
    34â†’    closeBtn.setAttribute('aria-label', 'Close notification');
    35â†’    closeBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
    36â†’        dismissNotification(notification);
    37â†’    });
    38â†’    notification.appendChild(closeBtn);
    39â†’
    40â†’    // Add to container
    41â†’    container.appendChild(notification);
    42â†’
    43â†’    // Trigger animation
    44â†’    requestAnimationFrame(() => {
    45â†’        notification.classList.add('notification-visible');
    46â†’    });
    47â†’
    48â†’    // Auto-dismiss if specified
    49â†’    if (autoDismiss > 0) {
    50â†’        setTimeout(() => {
    51â†’            dismissNotification(notification);
    52â†’        }, autoDismiss);
    53â†’    }
    54â†’}
    55â†’
    56â†’/**
    57â†’ * Dismiss a notification with animation
    58â†’ * @param {HTMLElement} notification - The notification element to dismiss
    59â†’ */
    60â†’function dismissNotification(notification) {
    61â†’    notification.classList.remove('notification-visible');
    62â†’    notification.classList.add('notification-dismissed');
    63â†’
    64â†’    // Remove from DOM after animation
    65â†’    setTimeout(() => {
    66â†’        notification.remove();
    67â†’
    68â†’        // Clean up container if empty
    69â†’        const container = document.getElementById('notificationContainer');
    70â†’        if (container && container.children.length === 0) {
    71â†’            container.remove();
    72â†’        }
    73â†’    }, 300);
    74â†’}
    75â†’
    76â†’/**
    77â†’ * Convenience function for error messages
    78â†’ * @param {string} message - The error message to display
    79â†’ */
    80â†’export function showError(message) {
    81â†’    showMessage(message, 'error');
    82â†’}
    83â†’
    84â†’/**
    85â†’ * Convenience function for success messages
    86â†’ * @param {string} message - The success message to display
    87â†’ * @param {number} autoDismiss - Auto-dismiss after N milliseconds (default: 3000)
    88â†’ */
    89â†’export function showSuccess(message, autoDismiss = 3000) {
    90â†’    showMessage(message, 'success', autoDismiss);
    91â†’}
    92â†’
    93â†’/**
    94â†’ * Convenience function for info messages
    95â†’ * @param {string} message - The info message to display
    96â†’ * @param {number} autoDismiss - Auto-dismiss after N milliseconds (default: 5000)
    97â†’ */
    98â†’export function showInfo(message, autoDismiss = 5000) {
    99â†’    showMessage(message, 'info', autoDismiss);
   100â†’}
   101â†’

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

   309â†’}

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

     1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Trifle App - Main Integration
     3â†’ * Wires together the UI (index.html), IndexedDB (db.js), and name generator (namegen.js)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { generateName } from './namegen.js';
     7â†’import { TrifleDB } from './db.js';
     8â†’import { SyncManager } from './sync-kv.js';
     9â†’import { showError } from './notifications.js';
    10â†’
    11â†’// Current user (cached after init)
    12â†’let currentUser = null;
    13â†’
    14â†’/**
    15â†’ * Initialize the app on page load
    16â†’ */
    17â†’async function init() {
    18â†’    try {
    19â†’        // Initialize user (create if doesn't exist)
    20â†’        await initUser();
    21â†’
    22â†’        // Update sync status
    23â†’        await updateSyncStatus();
    24â†’
    25â†’        // Load and display trifles
    26â†’        await loadTrifles();
    27â†’
    28â†’        // Set up event listeners
    29â†’        setupEventListeners();
    30â†’
    31â†’    } catch (error) {
    32â†’        console.error('Failed to initialize app:', error);
    33â†’        showError('Failed to load app. Please refresh the page.');
    34â†’    }
    35â†’}
    36â†’
    37â†’/**
    38â†’ * Initialize user (create anonymous user if none exists)
    39â†’ */
    40â†’async function initUser() {
    41â†’    currentUser = await TrifleDB.getCurrentUser();
    42â†’
    43â†’    if (!currentUser) {
    44â†’        // First-time user - create anonymous user with random name
    45â†’        const displayName = generateName();
    46â†’        currentUser = await TrifleDB.createUser(displayName);
    47â†’        console.log('Created new user:', displayName);
    48â†’    }
    49â†’
    50â†’    // Display user info
    51â†’    const userData = await TrifleDB.getUserData(currentUser.id);
    52â†’    updateUserDisplay(userData.display_name);
    53â†’}
    54â†’
    55â†’/**
    56â†’ * Update user display in the UI
    57â†’ */
    58â†’function updateUserDisplay(displayName) {
    59â†’    const nameElement = document.getElementById('profileName');
    60â†’    if (nameElement) {
    61â†’        nameElement.textContent = displayName;
    62â†’    }
    63â†’}
    64â†’
    65â†’/**
    66â†’ * Update sync status in the UI
    67â†’ */
    68â†’async function updateSyncStatus() {
    69â†’    const statusElement = document.getElementById('profileStatus');
    70â†’    const loginSyncBtn = document.getElementById('loginSyncBtn');
    71â†’
    72â†’    if (!statusElement || !loginSyncBtn) return;
    73â†’
    74â†’    // Check if logged in
    75â†’    const loggedIn = await SyncManager.isLoggedIn();
    76â†’    const syncStatus = SyncManager.getSyncStatus();
    77â†’
    78â†’    if (loggedIn) {
    79â†’        // Logged in - show sync status
    80â†’        if (syncStatus.synced && syncStatus.lastSync) {
    81â†’            const lastSyncTime = formatTimeAgo(syncStatus.lastSync);
    82â†’            statusElement.textContent = `Synced ${lastSyncTime}${syncStatus.email ? ' â€¢ ' + syncStatus.email : ''}`;
    83â†’        } else {
    84â†’            statusElement.textContent = 'Logged in â€¢ Not synced yet';
    85â†’        }
    86â†’        loginSyncBtn.textContent = 'Sync Now';
    87â†’        loginSyncBtn.className = 'btn btn-primary';
    88â†’    } else {
    89â†’        // Not logged in
    90â†’        statusElement.textContent = 'Local only â€¢ Not synced';
    91â†’        loginSyncBtn.textContent = 'Login & Sync';
    92â†’        loginSyncBtn.className = 'btn btn-primary';
    93â†’    }
    94â†’}
    95â†’
    96â†’/**
    97â†’ * Handle login and sync
    98â†’ */
    99â†’async function handleLoginSync() {
   100â†’    const loggedIn = await SyncManager.isLoggedIn();
   101â†’
   102â†’    if (!loggedIn) {
   103â†’        // Not logged in - redirect to OAuth
   104â†’        window.location.href = '/auth/login';
   105â†’        return;
   106â†’    }
   107â†’
   108â†’    // Already logged in - trigger sync
   109â†’    const btn = document.getElementById('loginSyncBtn');
   110â†’    if (btn) {
   111â†’        btn.textContent = 'Syncing...';
   112â†’        btn.disabled = true;
   113â†’    }
   114â†’
   115â†’    try {
   116â†’        const result = await SyncManager.sync();
   117â†’
   118â†’        if (result.success) {
   119â†’            // Sync successful - reload user data, trifles, and status
   120â†’            currentUser = await TrifleDB.getCurrentUser();
   121â†’            const userData = await TrifleDB.getUserData(currentUser.id);
   122â†’            updateUserDisplay(userData.display_name);
   123â†’
   124â†’            await loadTrifles();
   125â†’            await updateSyncStatus();
   126â†’            console.log('[Sync] Sync completed successfully');
   127â†’        } else {
   128â†’            console.error('[Sync] Sync failed:', result.error);
   129â†’            showError('Sync failed: ' + result.error);
   130â†’        }
   131â†’    } catch (error) {
   132â†’        console.error('[Sync] Sync error:', error);
   133â†’        showError('Sync failed. Please try again.');
   134â†’    } finally {
   135â†’        if (btn) {
   136â†’            btn.disabled = false;
   137â†’            await updateSyncStatus(); // Restore button text
   138â†’        }
   139â†’    }
   140â†’}
   141â†’
   142â†’/**
   143â†’ * Load and display all trifles for current user
   144â†’ */
   145â†’async function loadTrifles() {
   146â†’    const trifles = await TrifleDB.getTriflesByOwner(currentUser.id);
   147â†’    const container = document.getElementById('triflesContainer');
   148â†’
   149â†’    if (!container) return;
   150â†’
   151â†’    // Clear loading message
   152â†’    container.innerHTML = '';
   153â†’
   154â†’    if (trifles.length === 0) {
   155â†’        // Show empty state
   156â†’        container.innerHTML = `
   157â†’            <div class="empty-state">
   158â†’                <h2>No Trifles yet</h2>
   159â†’                <p>Create your first Python project to get started</p>
   160â†’            </div>
   161â†’        `;
   162â†’        return;
   163â†’    }
   164â†’
   165â†’    // Create grid
   166â†’    const grid = document.createElement('div');
   167â†’    grid.className = 'trifles-grid';
   168â†’
   169â†’    // Create and display trifle cards
   170â†’    for (const trifle of trifles) {
   171â†’        const data = await TrifleDB.getTrifleData(trifle.id);
   172â†’        const card = createTrifleCard(trifle, data);
   173â†’        grid.appendChild(card);
   174â†’    }
   175â†’
   176â†’    container.appendChild(grid);
   177â†’}
   178â†’
   179â†’/**
   180â†’ * Create a trifle card element
   181â†’ */
   182â†’function createTrifleCard(trifle, data) {
   183â†’    const card = document.createElement('div');
   184â†’    card.className = 'trifle-card';
   185â†’    card.onclick = () => window.location.href = `/editor.html?id=${trifle.id}`;
   186â†’
   187â†’    // Delete button
   188â†’    const deleteBtn = document.createElement('button');
   189â†’    deleteBtn.className = 'delete-trifle-btn';
   190â†’    deleteBtn.textContent = 'Delete';
   191â†’    deleteBtn.onclick = (e) => {
   192â†’        e.stopPropagation();
   193â†’        deleteTrifle(trifle, data);
   194â†’    };
   195â†’
   196â†’    // Content wrapper
   197â†’    const content = document.createElement('div');
   198â†’    content.className = 'trifle-card-content';
   199â†’
   200â†’    // Title
   201â†’    const title = document.createElement('div');
   202â†’    title.className = 'trifle-title';
   203â†’    title.textContent = data.name;
   204â†’
   205â†’    // Description
   206â†’    const description = document.createElement('div');
   207â†’    description.className = 'trifle-description';
   208â†’
   209â†’    const descriptionText = document.createElement('span');
   210â†’    descriptionText.className = 'trifle-description-text';
   211â†’    descriptionText.textContent = data.description || 'No description';
   212â†’
   213â†’    const editBtn = document.createElement('button');
   214â†’    editBtn.className = 'edit-description-btn';
   215â†’    editBtn.textContent = 'âœŽ';
   216â†’    editBtn.title = 'Edit description';
   217â†’    editBtn.onclick = (e) => {
   218â†’        e.stopPropagation();
   219â†’        editDescription(trifle, data, descriptionText, description, card);
   220â†’    };
   221â†’
   222â†’    description.appendChild(descriptionText);
   223â†’    description.appendChild(editBtn);
   224â†’
   225â†’    // Meta
   226â†’    const meta = document.createElement('div');
   227â†’    meta.className = 'trifle-meta';
   228â†’    const fileCount = data.files?.length || 0;
   229â†’    const timeAgo = formatTimeAgo(trifle.last_modified);
   230â†’    meta.innerHTML = `
   231â†’        <span>${fileCount} ${fileCount === 1 ? 'file' : 'files'}</span>
   232â†’        <span>${timeAgo}</span>
   233â†’    `;
   234â†’
   235â†’    content.appendChild(title);
   236â†’    content.appendChild(description);
   237â†’    content.appendChild(meta);
   238â†’
   239â†’    card.appendChild(deleteBtn);
   240â†’    card.appendChild(content);
   241â†’
   242â†’    return card;
   243â†’}
   244â†’
   245â†’/**
   246â†’ * Delete trifle
   247â†’ */
   248â†’async function deleteTrifle(trifle, data) {
   249â†’    if (!confirm(`Delete "${data.name}"? This cannot be undone.`)) {
   250â†’        return;
   251â†’    }
   252â†’
   253â†’    try {
   254â†’        await TrifleDB.deleteTrifle(trifle.id);
   255â†’        // Reload the trifles list
   256â†’        await loadTrifles();
   257â†’    } catch (error) {
   258â†’        console.error('Error deleting trifle:', error);
   259â†’        showError('Failed to delete trifle. Please try again.');
   260â†’    }
   261â†’}
   262â†’
   263â†’/**
   264â†’ * Edit description
   265â†’ */
   266â†’async function editDescription(trifle, data, descriptionTextElement, descriptionContainer, card) {
   267â†’    const currentDescription = data.description || '';
   268â†’
   269â†’    // Add editing class to disable card hover/click
   270â†’    card.classList.add('editing');
   271â†’
   272â†’    // Disable card onclick
   273â†’    const originalOnClick = card.onclick;
   274â†’    card.onclick = null;
   275â†’
   276â†’    // Create textarea
   277â†’    const textarea = document.createElement('textarea');
   278â†’    textarea.className = 'description-input';
   279â†’    textarea.value = currentDescription;
   280â†’
   281â†’    // Replace description with textarea
   282â†’    descriptionContainer.innerHTML = '';
   283â†’    descriptionContainer.appendChild(textarea);
   284â†’
   285â†’    // Handle clicks outside the textarea
   286â†’    const handleClickOutside = (e) => {
   287â†’        if (!textarea.contains(e.target)) {
   288â†’            saveDescription();
   289â†’        }
   290â†’    };
   291â†’
   292â†’    // Add click outside listener after a short delay to avoid immediate triggering
   293â†’    setTimeout(() => {
   294â†’        document.addEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
   295â†’    }, 100);
   296â†’
   297â†’    textarea.focus();
   298â†’    textarea.select();
   299â†’
   300â†’    const saveDescription = async () => {
   301â†’        const newDescription = textarea.value.trim();
   302â†’
   303â†’        // Remove editing class and restore onclick
   304â†’        card.classList.remove('editing');
   305â†’        card.onclick = originalOnClick;
   306â†’
   307â†’        // Remove click outside listener
   308â†’        document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
   309â†’
   310â†’        // Restore original structure
   311â†’        const descriptionText = document.createElement('span');
   312â†’        descriptionText.className = 'trifle-description-text';
   313â†’        descriptionText.textContent = newDescription || 'No description';
   314â†’
   315â†’        const editBtn = document.createElement('button');
   316â†’        editBtn.className = 'edit-description-btn';
   317â†’        editBtn.textContent = 'âœŽ';
   318â†’        editBtn.title = 'Edit description';
   319â†’        editBtn.onclick = (e) => {
   320â†’            e.stopPropagation();
   321â†’            editDescription(trifle, data, descriptionText, descriptionContainer, card);
   322â†’        };
   323â†’
   324â†’        descriptionContainer.innerHTML = '';
   325â†’        descriptionContainer.appendChild(descriptionText);
   326â†’        descriptionContainer.appendChild(editBtn);
   327â†’
   328â†’        // If description changed, save to IndexedDB
   329â†’        if (newDescription !== currentDescription) {
   330â†’            try {
   331â†’                // Get current trifle data
   332â†’                const trifleData = await TrifleDB.getTrifleData(trifle.id);
   333â†’
   334â†’                // Update description
   335â†’                trifleData.description = newDescription;
   336â†’
   337â†’                // Save to IndexedDB
   338â†’                await TrifleDB.updateTrifle(trifle.id, trifleData);
   339â†’
   340â†’                // Update local reference
   341â†’                data.description = newDescription;
   342â†’            } catch (error) {
   343â†’                console.error('Error updating description:', error);
   344â†’                showError('Failed to update description. Please try again.');
   345â†’                // Restore old description on error
   346â†’                descriptionText.textContent = currentDescription || 'No description';
   347â†’            }
   348â†’        }
   349â†’    };
   350â†’
   351â†’    textarea.addEventListener('keydown', (e) => {
   352â†’        if (e.key === 'Enter' && (e.ctrlKey || e.metaKey)) {
   353â†’            e.preventDefault();
   354â†’            saveDescription();
   355â†’        } else if (e.key === 'Escape') {
   356â†’            e.preventDefault();
   357â†’            // Cancel - restore original
   358â†’
   359â†’            // Remove editing class and restore onclick
   360â†’            card.classList.remove('editing');
   361â†’            card.onclick = originalOnClick;
   362â†’
   363â†’            // Remove click outside listener
   364â†’            document.removeEventListener('mousedown', handleClickOutside);
   365â†’
   366â†’            const descriptionText = document.createElement('span');
   367â†’            descriptionText.className = 'trifle-description-text';
   368â†’            descriptionText.textContent = currentDescription || 'No description';
   369â†’
   370â†’            const editBtn = document.createElement('button');
   371â†’            editBtn.className = 'edit-description-btn';
   372â†’            editBtn.textContent = 'âœŽ';
   373â†’            editBtn.title = 'Edit description';
   374â†’            editBtn.onclick = (e) => {
   375â†’                e.stopPropagation();
   376â†’                editDescription(trifle, data, descriptionText, descriptionContainer, card);
   377â†’            };
   378â†’
   379â†’            descriptionContainer.innerHTML = '';
   380â†’            descriptionContainer.appendChild(descriptionText);
   381â†’            descriptionContainer.appendChild(editBtn);
   382â†’        }
   383â†’    });
   384â†’}
   385â†’
   386â†’/**
   387â†’ * Handle creating a new trifle from modal
   388â†’ */
   389â†’async function handleNewTrifle(title, description) {
   390â†’    try {
   391â†’        const newTrifle = await TrifleDB.createTrifle(
   392â†’            currentUser.id,
   393â†’            title,
   394â†’            description
   395â†’        );
   396â†’
   397â†’        // Navigate to editor
   398â†’        window.location.href = `/editor.html?id=${newTrifle.id}`;
   399â†’    } catch (error) {
   400â†’        console.error('Failed to create trifle:', error);
   401â†’        showError('Failed to create new trifle. Please try again.');
   402â†’    }
   403â†’}
   404â†’
   405â†’/**
   406â†’ * Handle re-rolling the user's display name
   407â†’ */
   408â†’async function handleRerollName() {
   409â†’    try {
   410â†’        const newName = generateName();
   411â†’        const userData = await TrifleDB.getUserData(currentUser.id);
   412â†’        userData.display_name = newName;
   413â†’        await TrifleDB.updateUser(currentUser.id, userData);
   414â†’
   415â†’        // Update UI
   416â†’        updateUserDisplay(newName);
   417â†’
   418â†’        console.log('Name re-rolled to:', newName);
   419â†’    } catch (error) {
   420â†’        console.error('Failed to re-roll name:', error);
   421â†’        showError('Failed to change name. Please try again.');
   422â†’    }
   423â†’}
   424â†’
   425â†’/**
   426â†’ * Set up event listeners
   427â†’ */
   428â†’function setupEventListeners() {
   429â†’    // Re-roll name button
   430â†’    const rerollBtn = document.getElementById('rerollNameBtn');
   431â†’    if (rerollBtn) {
   432â†’        rerollBtn.addEventListener('click', handleRerollName);
   433â†’    }
   434â†’
   435â†’    // Login & Sync button
   436â†’    const loginSyncBtn = document.getElementById('loginSyncBtn');
   437â†’    if (loginSyncBtn) {
   438â†’        loginSyncBtn.addEventListener('click', handleLoginSync);
   439â†’    }
   440â†’
   441â†’    // Modal handling
   442â†’    const modal = document.getElementById('newTrifleModal');
   443â†’    const newTrifleBtn = document.getElementById('newTrifleBtn');
   444â†’    const cancelBtn = document.getElementById('cancelBtn');
   445â†’    const form = document.getElementById('newTrifleForm');
   446â†’    const titleInput = document.getElementById('trifleTitle');
   447â†’
   448â†’    const closeModal = () => {
   449â†’        modal.classList.remove('active');
   450â†’        if (form) form.reset();
   451â†’    };
   452â†’
   453â†’    if (newTrifleBtn && modal) {
   454â†’        newTrifleBtn.addEventListener('click', () => {
   455â†’            modal.classList.add('active');
   456â†’            // Auto-focus title input
   457â†’            if (titleInput) {
   458â†’                setTimeout(() => titleInput.focus(), 100);
   459â†’            }
   460â†’        });
   461â†’    }
   462â†’
   463â†’    if (cancelBtn && modal && form) {
   464â†’        cancelBtn.addEventListener('click', closeModal);
   465â†’    }
   466â†’
   467â†’    if (modal) {
   468â†’        // Click outside to close
   469â†’        modal.addEventListener('click', (e) => {
   470â†’            if (e.target === modal) {
   471â†’                closeModal();
   472â†’            }
   473â†’        });
   474â†’
   475â†’        // Esc to close
   476â†’        document.addEventListener('keydown', (e) => {
   477â†’            if (e.key === 'Escape' && modal.classList.contains('active')) {
   478â†’                closeModal();
   479â†’            }
   480â†’        });
   481â†’    }
   482â†’
   483â†’    // Cmd/Ctrl+Enter to submit form
   484â†’    if (form) {
   485â†’        form.addEventListener('keydown', (e) => {
   486â†’            if ((e.metaKey || e.ctrlKey) && e.key === 'Enter') {
   487â†’                e.preventDefault();
   488â†’                form.requestSubmit();
   489â†’            }
   490â†’        });
   491â†’    }
   492â†’
   493â†’    // Create new trifle
   494â†’    if (form) {
   495â†’        form.addEventListener('submit', async (e) => {
   496â†’            e.preventDefault();
   497â†’
   498â†’            const title = document.getElementById('trifleTitle').value;
   499â†’            const description = document.getElementById('trifleDescription').value;
   500â†’
   501â†’            await handleNewTrifle(title, description);
   502â†’        });
   503â†’    }
   504â†’}
   505â†’
   506â†’/**
   507â†’ * Format timestamp as relative time (e.g., "5 minutes ago")
   508â†’ */
   509â†’function formatTimeAgo(timestamp) {
   510â†’    const now = Date.now();
   511â†’    const diff = now - timestamp;
   512â†’
   513â†’    const seconds = Math.floor(diff / 1000);
   514â†’    const minutes = Math.floor(seconds / 60);
   515â†’    const hours = Math.floor(minutes / 60);
   516â†’    const days = Math.floor(hours / 24);
   517â†’
   518â†’    if (days > 0) {
   519â†’        return `${days} ${days === 1 ? 'day' : 'days'} ago`;
   520â†’    } else if (hours > 0) {
   521â†’        return `${hours} ${hours === 1 ? 'hour' : 'hours'} ago`;
   522â†’    } else if (minutes > 0) {
   523â†’        return `${minutes} ${minutes === 1 ? 'minute' : 'minutes'} ago`;
   524â†’    } else {
   525â†’        return 'just now';
   526â†’    }
   527â†’}
   528â†’
   529â†’// Note: showError is now imported from notifications.js
   530â†’// It displays a dismissible notification banner instead of using alert()
   531â†’
   532â†’// Initialize on DOM ready
   533â†’if (document.readyState === 'loading') {
   534â†’    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', init);
   535â†’} else {
   536â†’    init();
   537â†’}
   538â†’

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

ðŸ‘¤ USER â€” 2025-10-24 21:10:39

Working Dir: /Users/zellyn/gh/trifle

Result:

     1â†’// Trifling Service Worker - Enables offline functionality
     2â†’const CACHE_VERSION = 'v16';
     3â†’const CACHE_NAME = `trifling-${CACHE_VERSION}`;
     4â†’
     5â†’// Resources to cache on install
     6â†’const STATIC_CACHE = [
     7â†’    '/',
     8â†’    '/index.html',
     9â†’    '/editor.html',
    10â†’    '/about.html',
    11â†’    '/css/app.css',
    12â†’    '/js/app.js',
    13â†’    '/js/editor.js',
    14â†’    '/js/db.js',
    15â†’    '/js/namegen.js',
    16â†’    '/js/notifications.js',
    17â†’    '/js/worker.js',
    18â†’    '/js/terminal.js',
    19â†’    '/js/sync-kv.js'
    20â†’];
    21â†’
    22â†’// CDN resources to cache (Ace Editor and Pyodide)
    23â†’const CDN_CACHE = [
    24â†’    'https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/ace/1.32.2/ace.js',
    25â†’    'https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/ace/1.32.2/mode-python.js',
    26â†’    'https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/ace/1.32.2/theme-monokai.js',
    27â†’    'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/pyodide/v0.28.3/full/pyodide.js',
    28â†’    'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/pyodide/v0.28.3/full/pyodide.asm.js',
    29â†’    'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/pyodide/v0.28.3/full/pyodide.asm.wasm',
    30â†’    'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/pyodide/v0.28.3/full/python_stdlib.zip',
    31â†’    'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/pyodide/v0.28.3/full/pyodide-lock.json'
    32â†’];
    33â†’
    34â†’// Install event - cache all resources
    35â†’self.addEventListener('install', (event) => {
    36â†’    console.log('[Service Worker] Installing...');
    37â†’
    38â†’    event.waitUntil(
    39â†’        caches.open(CACHE_NAME).then((cache) => {
    40â†’            console.log('[Service Worker] Caching static assets and CDN resources');
    41â†’
    42â†’            // Cache static assets
    43â†’            const staticPromise = cache.addAll(STATIC_CACHE);
    44â†’
    45â†’            // Cache CDN resources individually (they might fail, don't block on them)
    46â†’            const cdnPromises = CDN_CACHE.map((url) =>
    47â†’                cache.add(url).catch((err) => {
    48â†’                    console.warn(`[Service Worker] Failed to cache ${url}:`, err);
    49â†’                })
    50â†’            );
    51â†’
    52â†’            return Promise.all([staticPromise, ...cdnPromises]);
    53â†’        }).then(() => {
    54â†’            console.log('[Service Worker] Installation complete');
    55â†’            // Skip waiting to activate immediately
    56â†’            return self.skipWaiting();
    57â†’        })
    58â†’    );
    59â†’});
    60â†’
    61â†’// Activate event - clean up old caches
    62â†’self.addEventListener('activate', (event) => {
    63â†’    console.log('[Service Worker] Activating...');
    64â†’
    65â†’    event.waitUntil(
    66â†’        caches.keys().then((cacheNames) => {
    67â†’            return Promise.all(
    68â†’                cacheNames.map((cacheName) => {
    69â†’                    if (cacheName !== CACHE_NAME) {
    70â†’                        console.log('[Service Worker] Deleting old cache:', cacheName);
    71â†’                        return caches.delete(cacheName);
    72â†’                    }
    73â†’                })
    74â†’            );
    75â†’        }).then(() => {
    76â†’            console.log('[Service Worker] Activation complete');
    77â†’            // Claim all clients immediately
    78â†’            return self.clients.claim();
    79â†’        })
    80â†’    );
    81â†’});
    82â†’
    83â†’// Fetch event - serve from cache, fallback to network
    84â†’self.addEventListener('fetch', (event) => {
    85â†’    // Skip non-GET requests
    86â†’    if (event.request.method !== 'GET') {
    87â†’        return;
    88â†’    }
    89â†’
    90â†’    const url = new URL(event.request.url);
    91â†’
    92â†’    // NEVER cache API endpoints - they need fresh data
    93â†’    if (url.pathname.startsWith('/api/')) {
    94â†’        return; // Let it go to network
    95â†’    }
    96â†’
    97â†’    event.respondWith(
    98â†’        caches.match(event.request).then((cachedResponse) => {
    99â†’            if (cachedResponse) {
   100â†’                console.log('[Service Worker] Serving from cache:', event.request.url);
   101â†’                return cachedResponse;
   102â†’            }
   103â†’
   104â†’            // If not found and URL has query params, try without them
   105â†’            if (url.search) {
   106â†’                const urlWithoutQuery = new URL(url.pathname, url.origin);
   107â†’                return caches.match(urlWithoutQuery).then((cachedResponseNoQuery) => {
   108â†’                    if (cachedResponseNoQuery) {
   109â†’                        console.log('[Service Worker] Serving from cache (no query):', url.pathname);
   110â†’                        return cachedResponseNoQuery;
   111â†’                    }
   112â†’
   113â†’                    // Not in cache, fetch from network
   114â†’                    return fetchFromNetwork();
   115â†’                });
   116â†’            }
   117â†’
   118â†’            // Not in cache, fetch from network
   119â†’            return fetchFromNetwork();
   120â†’        })
   121â†’    );
   122â†’
   123â†’    function fetchFromNetwork() {
   124â†’        console.log('[Service Worker] Fetching from network:', event.request.url);
   125â†’        return fetch(event.request).then((response) => {
   126â†’                // Don't cache if not a valid response
   127â†’                if (!response || response.status !== 200 || response.type === 'error') {
   128â†’                    return response;
   129â†’                }
   130â†’
   131â†’                // Clone the response (can only be consumed once)
   132â†’                const responseToCache = response.clone();
   133â†’
   134â†’                // Cache the response for future use (but not API endpoints)
   135â†’                if (!url.pathname.startsWith('/api/')) {
   136â†’                    caches.open(CACHE_NAME).then((cache) => {
   137â†’                        cache.put(event.request, responseToCache);
   138â†’                    });
   139â†’                }
   140â†’
   141â†’                return response;
   142â†’            }).catch((err) => {
   143â†’                console.error('[Service Worker] Fetch failed:', event.request.url, err);
   144â†’
   145â†’                // If it's a navigation request and we're offline, show a friendly message
   146â†’                if (event.request.mode === 'navigate') {
   147â†’                    return new Response(
   148â†’                        '<html><body><h1>Offline</h1><p>You are offline and this page is not cached.</p></body></html>',
   149â†’                        { headers: { 'Content-Type': 'text/html' } }
   150â†’                    );
   151â†’                }
   152â†’
   153â†’                throw err;
   154â†’            });
   155â†’    }
   156â†’});
   157â†’
   158â†’// Message event - handle commands from the page
   159â†’self.addEventListener('message', (event) => {
   160â†’    if (event.data && event.data.type === 'SKIP_WAITING') {
   161â†’        self.skipWaiting();
   162â†’    }
   163â†’});
   164â†’
